svg:

Mobius Instance (MI)Licence Server (LS)EncryptionOn first start mobius creates public / private key pair and unique instance ID (MIID)First message to LS includes:Licence code, MIID and mobius public key in payload Mobius public keyLS checks: - licence code not already used - MIID is unique and not assigned to licence codeLS creates: - a new rolling key and stores it in DB - and new validity code encrypted with Rkey. Validity code contains licence size and expiry date and validity code expiry date / timeLS sends responseResponse payload: - <validity code>.<Rkey>LS public keyMobius public keyMobius saves <validity code>.<Rkey> Mobius periodically checks its validity code by firstdecrypting it with rolling key.If rolling key has expired or mobius licence is no longervalid (licence expired or too many objects) mobiustries one licence validity check as described below.If this check also fails all mobius services stop.Standard period licence checkMessage includes licence code, MIID and RkeyMobius public keyLS public key(top is inside, bottom is outside)LS checks: - If Rkeys match - licence code not already used - MIID is unique and not assigned to licence codeLS creates: - a new rolling key and stores it in DB - and new validity code encrypted with Rkey. Validity code contains licence size and expiry date and validity code expiry date / timeLS sends responseResponse payload: - <validity code>.<Rkey>LS public keyMobius public keyMobius saves <validity code>.<Rkey>
